page.title: 18THE LOCAL D.H.S.S. OFFICE
page.content: THE LOCAL D.H.S.S. OFFICE The Department of Health and Social Security Benefit Office, opposite Christ The King school, deals with unemployment benefit. The office opens for the public from Monday to Friday at 9.00 am till 3.30 pm. Twenty six people work here. They have to sort out how much money to give people who are unemployed. This office deals with 2800 claims every two weeks. The number of claims at this office has doubled since 1981 because there are so many more people out of work now. The building is only like a wooden hut with an extra mobile unit at the side. It was built in 1930 and was a "soup kitchen". This office covers the whole of the Walkden area. The unemployed do not usually collect their benefit from this office unless there is a postal strike.
